mdRecord.dcterms:title: Abe Lincoln's Union wagon / by James D. Gay, Army Song Dealer and Publisher, No. 300 North 20th St., Philadelphia, Pa. All of Gay's Army songs sent by Mail. ; Air: "Wait for the Wagon," or "Old Virginia low lands."
Eagle of Columbia in majesty and pride
Old Union wagon
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Gay, James D.
Magnus, Charles.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St., N.Y.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Also published under title "Old Union wagon."
The title is over-printed on the imprint.
Civil War song sheet, in 7 verses, with chorus which is printed only after the 1st verse; without music; printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First line of 4th verse reads "Brave Hancock's in the Wagon, Meade and Warren by his side."

Hand-colored headpiece features a representation of Columbia on the left and, on the right, a portrait of Lincoln framed in a star against a background of flags, with a small vignette of the Capitol below; Magnus 8. Cf. American song sheets, 1736f.
At end of text below border: Entered ... in the year 1864, by James D. Gay, in the Clerk's Office of the Eastern District of Pennsylvania.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Eleventh of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
